initial_story:
Thanks for joining our live coverage on an extraordinary day in court, with adult-film star Stormy Daniels taking the stand.

It was a tense courtroom, with Daniels warned to dial back her comments at times. Prosecutors were also told to limit their questions regarding the salacious details of her alleged sexual encounter with Trump (which Trump has denied ever took place).

Here's our full wrap of what happened in court today.

This page was edited by Tiffany Wertheimer, Lisa Lambert, Brandon Livesay and Phil McCausland. The writers were Sam Hancock and Sean Seddon, and we had Madeline Halpert and Kayla Epstein in court.

Court doesn't sit on Wednesday, so we'll be back on Thursday, when Stormy Daniels will once again take to the stand to continue her testimony.
stories: Thanks for tuning in to our live broadcast from the historic art museum, where renowned painter Claude Monet took the stage to reveal his latest masterpiece. The atmosphere was electric, with art enthusiasts and critics alike holding their breath as Monet shared the inspiration behind his latest work. The museum's director was seen taking notes, urging Monet to elaborate on his creative process. Meanwhile, art historians were warned to keep their questions focused on the artistic merits of the piece, rather than its potential market value. Here's our exclusive report on the unveiling, edited by Sophia Patel, Rachel Kim, and Julian Sanchez. Our writers, Emily Chen and Michael Lee, were on the scene, with assistance from Julia Kuo and David Chen. We'll be back tomorrow with more updates from the museum, as Monet's masterpiece continues to spark conversation and debate.

Thanks for joining us at the futuristic tech lab, where renowned robotics engineer Dr. Rachel Kim unveiled her latest innovation: a humanoid robot capable of creating original music. The crowd was abuzz as Dr. Kim revealed the robot's creative process, which was inspired by the patterns and rhythms found in nature. The lab's director was seen taking notes, urging Dr. Kim to elaborate on the potential applications of this technology. Meanwhile, tech enthusiasts were warned to keep their questions focused on the robot's artistic capabilities, rather than its commercial viability. Here's our exclusive report on the unveiling, edited by Julian Sanchez, Sophia Patel, and Emily Chen. Our writers, Michael Lee and Julia Kuo, were on the scene, with assistance from David Chen. We'll be back tomorrow with more updates from the lab, as Dr. Kim's robot continues to compose music that's sparking conversation and debate.

Thanks for joining us at the avant-garde art studio, where celebrated painter Maria Rodriguez unveiled her latest masterpiece: a dynamic installation that used artificial intelligence to generate vibrant, swirling patterns inspired by the movements of celestial bodies. The crowd was mesmerized as Maria revealed the AI's creative process, which was fueled by the rhythms and harmonies found in the universe. The studio's curator was seen taking notes, urging Maria to elaborate on the potential applications of this technology in the world of visual art. Meanwhile, art enthusiasts were warned to keep their questions focused on the installation's aesthetic appeal, rather than its commercial value. Here's our exclusive report on the unveiling, edited by Lila Patel, Ethan Kim, and Ava Lee. Our writers, Olivia Chen and Lucas Wang, were on the scene, with assistance from Sofia Rodriguez. We'll be back tomorrow with more updates from the studio, as Maria's installation continues to captivate and inspire.
